summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for July 25, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it pertains to the date of Jeffrey Epstein's death while in custody.

events.title: Inmate Observation Logs
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted throughout the day and night.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison logs from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 25, 2019.
The logs detail mandatory 30-minute observation checks for inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
The date corresponds to the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC.
The logs cover multiple tiers (ZA Tier-G, H, J, K; L-Tier; M-Tier; ZB) within the Special Housing Unit.
The forms require signatures from Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch Operations Lieutenants, and are reviewed by a Captain.
